answers.answer: When your fasting blood sugar levels exceed 126 mg/dl fasting you are considered a type 2 diabetic. When your blood sugar levels - fasting, preprandial and postprandial - remain above normal and steadily elevate for a constant and long period of time you would be considered a "full blown" diabetic [no turning back to normal]. If one ignores making lifestyle changes in order to control and manage their diabetes, their diabetes becomes a progressive disease where severe side effects become a reality.
